content: while working with the triage team I've noticed a lot of PRs are bottlenecked on the availability of reviewers. while I'm reluctant to call myself qualified to review every arbitrary libs PR, I'd be happy to review "minor" PRs, e.g. simple refactorings, cleanups, documentation. is there precedence for such a role? one consequence is that highfive probably shouldn't auto-assign a minor reviewer unless it's smart about it, e.g. if a PR only touches documentation or if it is under a certain number of lines. would this be useful?

From my perspective fwiw it's quite helpful to see folks do a review and indicate they feel good with a PR, it often means I can quickly skim and approve whereas otherwise each PR is more of an unknown time commitment to review
